A11y.description: A list of rules that belong to this group

all.description: It enables ALL rules for this group.

noAccessKey.description: Enforce that the accessKey attribute is not used on any HTML element.

noAriaHiddenOnFocusable.description: Enforce that aria-hidden="true" is not set on focusable elements.

noAriaUnsupportedElements.description: Enforce that elements that do not support ARIA roles, states, and properties do not have those attributes.

noAutofocus.description: Enforce that autoFocus prop is not used on elements.

noDistractingElements.description: Enforces that no distracting elements are used.

noHeaderScope.description: The scope prop should be used only on <th> elements.

noInteractiveElementToNoninteractiveRole.description: Enforce that non-interactive ARIA roles are not assigned to interactive HTML elements.

noNoninteractiveElementToInteractiveRole.description: Enforce that interactive ARIA roles are not assigned to non-interactive HTML elements.

noNoninteractiveTabindex.description: Enforce that tabIndex is not assigned to non-interactive HTML elements.

noPositiveTabindex.description: Prevent the usage of positive integers on tabIndex property

noRedundantAlt.description: Enforce img alt prop does not contain the word "image", "picture", or "photo".

noRedundantRoles.description: Enforce explicit role property is not the same as implicit/default role property on an element.

noSvgWithoutTitle.description: Enforces the usage of the title element for the svg element.

recommended.description: It enables the recommended rules for this group

useAltText.description: Enforce that all elements that require alternative text have meaningful information to relay back to the end user.

useAnchorContent.description: Enforce that anchors have content and that the content is accessible to screen readers.

useAriaActivedescendantWithTabindex.description: Enforce that tabIndex is assigned to non-interactive HTML elements with aria-activedescendant.

useAriaPropsForRole.description: Enforce that elements with ARIA roles must have all required ARIA attributes for that role.

useButtonType.description: Enforces the usage of the attribute type for the element button

useHeadingContent.description: Enforce that heading elements (h1, h2, etc.) have content and that the content is accessible to screen readers. Accessible means that it is not hidden using the aria-hidden prop.

useHtmlLang.description: Enforce that html element has lang attribute.

useIframeTitle.description: Enforces the usage of the attribute title for the element iframe.

useKeyWithClickEvents.description: Enforce onClick is accompanied by at least one of the following: onKeyUp, onKeyDown, onKeyPress.

useKeyWithMouseEvents.description: Enforce onMouseOver / onMouseOut are accompanied by onFocus / onBlur.

useMediaCaption.description: Enforces that audio and video elements must have a track for captions.

useValidAnchor.description: Enforce that all anchors are valid, and they are navigable elements.

useValidAriaProps.description: Ensures that ARIA properties aria-* are all valid.

useValidAriaRole.description: Elements with ARIA roles must use a valid, non-abstract ARIA role.

useValidAriaValues.description: Enforce that ARIA state and property values are valid.

useValidLang.description: Ensure that the attribute passed to the lang attribute is a correct ISO language and/or country.

Complexity.description: A list of rules that belong to this group

all.description: It enables ALL rules for this group.

noBannedTypes.description: Disallow primitive type aliases and misleading types.

noExcessiveCognitiveComplexity.description: Disallow functions that exceed a given Cognitive Complexity score.

noForEach.description: Prefer for...of statement instead of Array.forEach.

noMultipleSpacesInRegularExpressionLiter.description: Disallow unclear usage of consecutive space characters in regular expression literals

noStaticOnlyClass.description: This rule reports when a class has no non-static members, such as for a class used exclusively as a static namespace.

noThisInStatic.description: Disallow this and super in static contexts.

noUselessEmptyExport.description: Disallow empty exports that don't change anything in a module file.

noUselessRename.description: Disallow renaming import, export, and destructured assignments to the same name.

noUselessSwitchCase.description: Disallow useless case in switch statements.

noUselessTypeConstraint.description: Disallow using any or unknown as type constraint.

noVoid.description: Disallow the use of void operators, which is not a familiar operator.

noWith.description: Disallow with statements in non-strict contexts.

recommended.description: It enables the recommended rules for this group

useArrowFunction.description: Use arrow functions over function expressions.

useFlatMap.description: Promotes the use of .flatMap() when map().flat() are used together.

useLiteralKeys.description: Enforce the usage of a literal access to properties over computed property access.

useOptionalChain.description: Enforce using concise optional chain instead of chained logical expressions.

useRegexLiterals.description: Enforce the use of the regular expression literals instead of the RegExp constructor if possible.

useSimpleNumberKeys.description: Disallow number literal object member names which are not base10 or uses underscore as separator

useSimplifiedLogicExpression.description: Discard redundant terms from logical expressions.

maxAllowedComplexity.description: The maximum complexity score that we allow. Anything higher is considered excessive.

Correctness.description: A list of rules that belong to this group

all.description: It enables ALL rules for this group.

noChildrenProp.description: Prevent passing of children as props.

noConstAssign.description: Prevents from having const variables being re-assigned.

noConstructorReturn.description: Disallow returning a value from a constructor.

noEmptyCharacterClassInRegex.description: Disallow empty character classes in regular expression literals.

noGlobalObjectCalls.description: Disallow calling global object properties as functions

noInnerDeclarations.description: Disallow function and var declarations that are accessible outside their block.

noInvalidConstructorSuper.description: Prevents the incorrect use of super() inside classes. It also checks whether a call super() is missing from classes that extends other constructors.

noInvalidNewBuiltin.description: Disallow new operators with global non-constructor functions.

noNewSymbol.description: Disallow new operators with the Symbol object.

noNonoctalDecimalEscape.description: Disallow \8 and \9 escape sequences in string literals.

noPrecisionLoss.description: Disallow literal numbers that lose precision

noRenderReturnValue.description: Prevent the usage of the return value of React.render.

noSelfAssign.description: Disallow assignments where both sides are exactly the same.

noSetterReturn.description: Disallow returning a value from a setter

noStringCaseMismatch.description: Disallow comparison of expressions modifying the string case with non-compliant value.

noSwitchDeclarations.description: Disallow lexical declarations in switch clauses.

noUndeclaredVariables.description: Prevents the usage of variables that haven't been declared inside the document.

noUnreachableSuper.description: Ensures the super() constructor is called exactly once on every code  path in a class constructor before this is accessed if the class has a superclass

noUnsafeFinally.description: Disallow control flow statements in finally blocks.

noUnsafeOptionalChaining.description: Disallow the use of optional chaining in contexts where the undefined value is not allowed.

noVoidElementsWithChildren.description: This rules prevents void elements (AKA self-closing elements) from having children.

noVoidTypeReturn.description: Disallow returning a value from a function with the return type 'void'

recommended.description: It enables the recommended rules for this group

useExhaustiveDependencies.description: Enforce all dependencies are correctly specified in a React hook.

useHookAtTopLevel.description: Enforce that all React hooks are being called from the Top Level component functions.

useIsNan.description: Require calls to isNaN() when checking for NaN.

useValidForDirection.description: Enforce "for" loop update clause moving the counter in the right direction.

useYield.description: Require generator functions to contain yield.

Style.description: A list of rules that belong to this group

all.description: It enables ALL rules for this group.

noImplicitBoolean.description: Disallow implicit true values on JSX boolean attributes

noInferrableTypes.description: Disallow type annotations for variables, parameters, and class properties initialized with a literal expression.

noNamespace.description: Disallow the use of TypeScript's namespaces.

noNegationElse.description: Disallow negation in the condition of an if statement if it has an else clause.

noNonNullAssertion.description: Disallow non-null assertions using the ! postfix operator.

noParameterProperties.description: Disallow the use of parameter properties in class constructors.

noRestrictedGlobals.description: This rule allows you to specify global variable names that you dont want to use in your application.

noShoutyConstants.description: Disallow the use of constants which its value is the upper-case version of its name.

noUnusedTemplateLiteral.description: Disallow template literals if interpolation and special-character handling are not needed

useAsConstAssertion.description: Enforce the use of as const over literal type and type annotation.

useCollapsedElseIf.description: Enforce using else if instead of nested if in else clauses.

useConst.description: Require const declarations for variables that are never reassigned after declared.

useDefaultParameterLast.description: Enforce default function parameters and optional function parameters to be last.

useEnumInitializers.description: Require that each enum member value be explicitly initialized.

useExponentiationOperator.description: Disallow the use of Math.pow in favor of the ** operator.

useFragmentSyntax.description: This rule enforces the use of <>...</> over <Fragment>...</Fragment>.

useLiteralEnumMembers.description: Require all enum members to be literal values.

useNamingConvention.description: Enforce naming conventions for everything across a codebase.

useNumericLiterals.description: Disallow parseInt() and Number.parseInt() in favor of binary, octal, and hexadecimal literals

useSelfClosingElements.description: Prevent extra closing tags for components without children

useShorthandArrayType.description: When expressing array types, this rule promotes the usage of T[] shorthand instead of Array<T>.

useShorthandAssign.description: Require assignment operator shorthand where possible.

useSingleCaseStatement.description: Enforces switch clauses have a single statement, emits a quick fix wrapping the statements in a block.

useSingleVarDeclarator.description: Disallow multiple variable declarations in the same variable statement

useTemplate.description: Prefer template literals over string concatenation.

useWhile.description: Enforce the use of while loops instead of for loops when the initializer and update expressions are not needed.

all.description: It enables ALL rules for this group.

noApproximativeNumericConstant.description: Usually, the definition in the standard library is more precise than what people come up with or the used constant exceeds the maximum precision of the number type.

noArrayIndexKey.description: Discourage the usage of Array index in keys.

noAsyncPromiseExecutor.description: Disallows using an async function as a Promise executor.

noCatchAssign.description: Disallow reassigning exceptions in catch clauses.

noCommentText.description: Prevent comments from being inserted as text nodes

noConfusingLabels.description: Disallow labeled statements that are not loops.

noConfusingVoidType.description: Disallow void type outside of generic or return types.

noControlCharactersInRegex.description: Prevents from having control characters and some escape sequences that match control characters in regular expressions.

noDuplicateJsxProps.description: Prevents JSX properties to be assigned multiple times.

noDuplicateObjectKeys.description: Prevents object literals having more than one property declaration for the same name.

noEmptyInterface.description: Disallow the declaration of empty interfaces.

noExtraNonNullAssertion.description: Prevents the wrong usage of the non-null assertion operator (!) in TypeScript files.

noGlobalIsFinite.description: Use Number.isFinite instead of global isFinite.

noGlobalIsNan.description: Use Number.isNaN instead of global isNaN.

noImplicitAnyLet.description: Disallow use of implicit any type on variable declarations.

noLabelVar.description: Disallow labels that share a name with a variable

noMisleadingInstantiator.description: Enforce proper usage of new and constructor.

noMisrefactoredShorthandAssign.description: Disallow shorthand assign when variable appears on both sides.

noPrototypeBuiltins.description: Disallow direct use of Object.prototype builtins.

noRedeclare.description: Disallow variable, function, class, and type redeclarations in the same scope.

noSelfCompare.description: Disallow comparisons where both sides are exactly the same.

noShadowRestrictedNames.description: Disallow identifiers from shadowing restricted names.

noUnsafeDeclarationMerging.description: Disallow unsafe declaration merging between interfaces and classes.

useGetterReturn.description: Enforce get methods to always return a value.

useIsArray.description: Use Array.isArray() instead of instanceof Array.

useNamespaceKeyword.description: Require using the namespace keyword over the module keyword to declare TypeScript namespaces.

useValidTypeof.description: This rule verifies the result of typeof $expr unary expressions is being compared to valid values, either string literals containing valid type names or other typeof expressions

Integration with the git client as VCS

VcsConfiguration.description: Set of properties to integrate Biome with a VCS software.

defaultBranch.description: The main branch of the project

enabled.description: Whether Biome should integrate itself with the VCS client

root.description:
The folder where Biome should check for VCS files. By default, Biome will use the same folder where `biome.json` was found.

If Biome can't find the configuration, it will attempt to use the current working directory. If no current working directory can't be found, Biome won't use the VCS integration, and a diagnostic will be emitted

useIgnoreFile.description: Whether Biome should use the VCS ignore file. When [true], Biome will ignore the files specified in the ignore file.
